results.content: 3demos.zip contains C# project and not TypeScript
results.content_html: 3demos.zip contains C# project and not TypeScript

results.content: So far any examples in PowerPoint are images and cannot copy. The examples do not line up with the examples from the official typescript documentation. More than half the course is about JavaScript and not TypeScript.
results.content_html: So far any examples in PowerPoint are images and cannot copy. The examples do not line up with the examples from the official typescript documentation. More than half the course is about JavaScript and not TypeScript.

results.content: Thank you! It's really good course for beginners! :)
results.content_html: Thank you! It's really good course for beginners! :)

results.content: it said in the title that it is zero to hero in typescript, but there is no actual coding, just some sample codes about basic programming like data types, conditions and loops. There are also sample codes describing the basic functionality of nodejs and moongose. This tutorial will not give a student a working knowledge on how to use typescript to build a nodejs application.
results.content_html: it said in the title that it is zero to hero in typescript, but there is no actual coding, just some sample codes about basic programming like data types, conditions and loops. There are also sample codes describing the basic functionality of nodejs and moongose. This tutorial will not give a student a working knowledge on how to use typescript to build a nodejs application.

results.content:
I am not yet finished with the course but find it very bothersome that the proper syntax is not followed in most of the course (up to chapter 6 at least).

Use of ==, attributes that are not typed in examples, incomplete descriptions (e.g. Hoisting - use of var), improper type mixing (whole point of typescript in the array examples).
results.content_html:
I am not yet finished with the course but find it very bothersome that the proper syntax is not followed in most of the course (up to chapter 6 at least).

Use of ==, attributes that are not typed in examples, incomplete descriptions (e.g. Hoisting - use of var), improper type mixing (whole point of typescript in the array examples).

results.content: I don't think that this powerpoint only courses can be realy helpfull...
results.content_html: I don't think that this powerpoint only courses can be realy helpfull...

results.content: Как по мне, матчасть тут расчитана на совсем новичков, это соответствует заявленому, но вот сказать что приводит к экспертному пониманию...ну..такое. Здесь не рассматривается ни то как в итоге код выполняется, ни то отличается ли TS от JS (хотя весь курс отсылается на знание js хоть на каком то уровне или предполагает что человек его изучит). При покупке курса ожидал что здесь вместе с информацией КАК писать TS код будет так же информация ЗАЧЕМ его писать и как это делать лучше, вместе с разбором каких то встроенных фич и как они реализуются. По началу так же надеялся на то что раз курс описается на знание JS то будет и разбор отличий TS от JS

results.content: The content and presentation is good.  Absolute beginners don't like it when expert programmers call things trivial.  Nothing is trivial to beginners.  There is defiantly a language obstacle.  You should speak  sentences with proper grammar.  The point form notes do help to overcome this barrier so far. I will see how it works with complex ideas and code.
results.content_html: The content and presentation is good. Absolute beginners don't like it when expert programmers call things trivial. Nothing is trivial to beginners. There is defiantly a language obstacle. You should speak sentences with proper grammar. The point form notes do help to overcome this barrier so far. I will see how it works with complex ideas and code.

results.content: NodeJS, ExpressJS, MongoDB/Mongoose are explained much too briefly and examples are in JAVASCRIPT. This supposed to be a TypeScript course.
results.content_html: NodeJS, ExpressJS, MongoDB/Mongoose are explained much too briefly and examples are in JAVASCRIPT. This supposed to be a TypeScript course.
